intro: [WRONG START] Achimenses flava, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces vibrant yellow flowers with a bell-shaped corolla. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Achimenes flava is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
